briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Burosumab Versus Oral Phosphate and Active Vitamin D Treatment in Pediatric Patients With XLH
officialTitle: A Randomized, Open-Label, Phase 3 Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of KRN23 Versus Oral Phosphate and Active Vitamin D Treatment in Pediatric Patients With X Linked Hypophosphatemia (XLH)
summary: The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the effect of KRN23 (burosumab) therapy in improving rickets in children with XLH compared with active control (oral phosphate/active vitamin D).

primaryOutcome.measure: Radiographic Global Impression of Change (RGI-C) Global Score at Week 40
